title: Banana Bread
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Coat an 8×4 inch loaf pan with cooking spray or butter.
Place peeled bananas in a microwave-safe bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and cut a few slits for air vents.
Pour bananas into a strainer over a bowl. Let liquid drain for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally (should yield about ½ cup liquid).
Transfer banana liquid to a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Boil, stirring often, until reduced by half (about ¼ cup).
Transfer mashed bananas to a large mixing bowl. Pour reduced liquid over bananas and stir until fairly smooth.
Whisk in brown sugar, eggs, cooled melted butter, and vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon.
Gradually add flour mixture to banana mixture until just combined.
Pour into prepared loaf pan. Sprinkle turbinado sugar evenly over batter.
Bake 50-60 minutes until a tester inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in pan for 15 minutes on a wire rack. Remove from pan and cool completely.
notes: Volume conversions: 5 large bananas ≈ 625g, 8 tbsp butter ≈ 113g, 2 eggs ≈ 100g, ¾ cup brown sugar ≈ 150g, 1 tsp vanilla ≈ 5g, 1¾ cups flour ≈ 210g, 1 tsp baking soda ≈ 5g, ½ tsp salt ≈ 3g, ½ tsp cinnamon ≈ 3g, ½ cup pecans ≈ 60g, 1 tbsp turbinado sugar ≈ 12g
